headline: Baked Ham and Cheese Sliders
description: These baked ham and cheese sliders feature mini rolls stuffed with deli ham and melted Swiss baked with a savory poppyseed-mustard sauce to make an easy, tasty little bite or appetizer.

video.description:
There's never a bad time to eat irresistibly decadent ham and cheese sliders. The party-friendly sandwiches in this video boast buttery rolls that surround savory deli meat, melted Swiss cheese, and sharp, spicy Dijon mustard. 
Whether you're feeding a large crowd or a family of four, these perfectly delicious oven-baked sliders are a surefire way to make it a celebratory occasion.
video.name: How to Make Baked Ham and Cheese Sliders

name: Baked Ham and Cheese Sliders
recipeIngredient: 1 pound thinly sliced cooked deli ham

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Mix butter, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, poppy seeds, and dried onion in a bowl.

Separate the tops from the bottoms of the rolls; arrange the bottom pieces in a layer in the prepared baking dish. Layer about 1/2 of the ham onto the rolls; add a layer of Swiss cheese and top with remaining ham slices.
Place the tops of the rolls onto the sandwiches. Pour mustard mixture evenly over the rolls
Bake in the preheated oven until the rolls are lightly browned and the cheese has melted, about 20 minutes. Slice into individual rolls through the ham and cheese layers to serve.

review.reviewBody: I made these for the first time last night and the family loved them. I used butter flavored hawaiian rolls and doubled the dijon mustard. I also left out the poppy seeds and used a mixture of minced garlic and onion powder (1 tbsp total). I made 12 with swiss cheese and 12 with muenster cheese. Don't be afraid to pour the entire mixture over the rolls. I was worried it was way too much at first and left some in the bowl. I was wrong! The topping cooks into the rolls perfectly. This recipe is definitely a keeper. Thanks Lisa!

Per recommendations, instead of poppy seeds, we used "everything" bagel seasoning and provolone and mozzarella instead of Swiss, and they came out great. My 16 year old made these without any help, and our guests loved them and came back for seconds and thirds during the Super Bowl. Easy clean-up! Definitely a keeper.

Quick and easy to make. I ended up using everything seasoning since it already had onion and poppy, with the garlic and sesame seed it made it more flavorful. Everyone loved it and liked that it wasn’t overwhelming with poppy that they had from someone else’s sliders. I ended up doing 2 sticks of butter, 2 tablespoons of Dijon and Worcestershire since I was using a bigger pan.

I found the original recipe online from King's Hawaiian rolls, and there is a critical step: "Drizzle butter mixture over ham and cheese, but save some to brush the top of your rolls with." Next time, I will definitely be doing that!! I thought it was odd that you would pour all of the mixture on top! The mixture runs off into the bottom of the dish, saturating only the bottom buns and making the bun tops hard. It felt like the mixture should be poured BEFORE adding the tops, and I was right! Also, next time I will add caramelized onions as a layer, rather than adding in minced onion or onion powder. And I will also cover the dish with foil until the last 5 minutes. Otherwise,, they dry out and the tops get too hard.

Great recipe! Only changes I made were I covered them the entire bake time, and sliced them before I drizzled and cooked them. (It made them much easier to handle than the first time I made a similar recipe.) Excellent party food!

I doubled this recipe (and eliminated poppy seeds) for a sober living household of 16, and had residents finding excuses to walk through the kitchen, no doubt to check the timer on the oven. The aroma is the legal kind of intoxicating. Forty-eight sandwiches didn't have a chance to get cold, were gone in minutes, and the residents begged me to make them again sometime. That 'sometime' will be today. I cook for this house every Saturday and often come back to allrecipes for delicious ideas.

I made this exactly as written expect I added a little mayo to the inside of the buns , I used whole wheat Hawaiian rolls, and I used a combo of sharp cheddar and Havarti cheeses. These were absolutely delicious! The hubs and the kiddo could NOT stop raving about these and went back for seconds and even thirds. The topping really does take these sandwiches over the top. They were so good, I made them a few days later with turkey, mustard, and provolone. I ran out of dried minced onion so I made some caramelized onion instead. Again, they were amazing. So glad I found this recipe! So simple yet so yummy.

Very good. Big hit. I have also made this with Provolone and Roast Beef using the Hawaiin Butter Buns. With the Beef I added (in addition to original "sauce") creamy horseradish sauce. I mix everything in softened butter and spread a light coat on the inside of the bottom buns. Then assemble and pour the remaining melted butter mixture over the top. When making either way I make ahead of time and let the flavors develop. I bake covered for 20 - 25 minutes then uncovered for remaining 5. Soooo good (the men prefer the Roast Beef)

Oh my gosh, I cannot express enough how absolutely delish this recipe is. So good. I just made it today for my mom for a little mothers day brunch. It was our first time making it, we are hooked. Already know this will be in our meal rotation, not just for a holiday, s yummy! I scaled the recipe to 12 serving for one package of the Hawaiian rolls. I got the rolls on clearance for 39 cents at Aldis and have 2 more packages in the freezer! My first time having those rolls too. I used regular yellow mustard and did rehydrate the dried onion before mixing in to the sauce as someone suggested. I did also add 2 Tb of brown sugar to the sauce. I was worried about pouring the liquid over the rolls it seemed like a lot, but do not alter the amount of the liquid at all, the recipe gives you the perfect amount for the amount of servings you are making. The sauce browned the sandwiches and there was a beautiful and yummy crust on the rolls from the butter/brown sugar mixture. My mom and I are excited about the leftovers! Happy Mothers Day! Thanks for a super awesome delicious recipe!

Growing up we had a variation of this we called "poker sandwiches" because Mom made them when Dad's friends came over to play poker. We used yellow mustard, onions, butter and poppy seeds with ham and swiss cheese and made the sandwiches individually with the mustard, onion, butter mixture on the inside of the sandwich. We wrapped them individually in foil, froze them, and popped them in the oven for poker night. Our version was always a hit and you can make a ton and keep them on hand for after-school snacks.
My sister and I make these rolls all the time! My family loves them and I know we will be making them for many years.

I have made these several times for my family and gatherings. This is a delish recipe as written and simple to make. It is great for large crowds and easy to prepare ahead of time. Just toss in oven when ready, go back to enjoying the party and wait for the compliments. I see openings for personal changes but I think this stands alone as is.
I frequently make something like this. It is a big hit. I have used Hawaiian rolls and make 1/2 roast beef and the other half ham.
The next time I make these (and there is definitely a next time) I’m going to sub the poppy deeds with black sesame seeds
I added a ham and turkey slice which covered 8 rolls and a extra slice of cheese which covered 4 rolls, it was awesome!!

I've made this many times with many variations of meat and cheese. As is, it's perfect! I just can't help myself when I find a great recipe to try and change things around a bit. I usually start mixing things up based on other reviews, so I did try it tonight brushing melted honey on the rolls. Then I brushed the butter mix on top of that. I'm feeding my best friend's family this week because her mom is in hospice and everyone is in town at her house. It was a hit!
I've been making these for 20 years and they are always a hit. We freeze the left overs and enjoy them for a quick snack while watching football.
This has become a staple in our house for an easy weeknight dinner. No changes. Everyone loves it!
